content:
Nice work @BWPanda (Peter)++ !
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/556#issuecomment-588421104

I can see this being a big benefit to someone testing things out for the first time and now being able to install a few modules as part of the trial process.

Allow installing contrib via project installer in tugboat demos · Issue #556 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Currently the installs fail with a permissions issue. It would be great to allow people to see how easy it is to extend Backdrop through the Project Installer and test out some contrib modules at t...
(peter)** Cheers (Karma: 9)

Merged the PR for https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/556 It totally works! Thanks @BWPanda (Peter) !

@BWPanda (Peter)++

Allow installing contrib via project installer in tugboat demos · Issue #556 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Currently the installs fail with a permissions issue. It would be great to allow people to see how easy it is to extend Backdrop through the Project Installer and test out some contrib modules at t...
(peter)** leveled up! (Karma: 10)
I have already tested it. I am so excited about this. @BWPanda (Peter) ++
(peter)** thanks for all you do (Karma: 11)
Woot! I love open source :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
And open-source loves YOU!!! :hearts: :pray:
...now next step is to eliminate the installer steps, and get people straight into ready-to-use instances :wink:

@klonos One step ahead of you: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/tugboat/issues/5 :wink:

Allow skipping installation · Issue #5 · backdrop-contrib/tugboat
When you just want to spin up a demo site to test some core functionality, or anything like that, you often don't want to have to go through the installation process each time. It'd be nice...
:sweat_smile:
@BWPanda (Peter)++
(peter)** thanks for all you do (Karma: 12)
Quick mockup screenshots added :wink:
fyi; this is a thing; image.png
Yep, fixing as we speak.

Long story is that I've pushed some changes and changed the way builds are done (to make it possible to automatically install and login to sandbox sites). Because of this, refreshing the master preview no longer works since it tries to install Backdrop over itself. This isn't a problem, except that it was set to automatically refresh every day (to keep the codebase up-to-date). I've disabled the auto-refreshing, but had to rebuild the master preview since it was broken. Because of that, all other previews got 'disconnected' from the master one, which meant suddenly they were taking up ~1GB each (instead of ~100MB). I re-built the master preview, and now it's going through all other previews rebuilding them. So the space problem will be fixed soon (if not already).
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) At least the new error messages work! :wink:
sweet; thanks!

Seems to be working. Therefore this is now also a thing! :tada:
image.png
excellent; @BWPanda (Peter) ++
(peter)** GG (Karma: 17)

Did a quick test and love the one-click install! When I tried to install a module I get this during the "Enable" step:

Failed to write configuration file: ./files/config_5bdcabd9c299f0000169ff24/active/user.role.administrator.json
@BWPanda (Peter) ++
Are demos in https://backdropcms.org/demo broken for anyone else, or is it just me? ...there's a "New site created successfully!" message, but no demo site gets created.
@Nate Lampton ^^
Same problem: Success message immediately, but no visible demo.
Tested in Chrome and Firefox.

Could this be the issue (that wasn't actually fixed correctly)? https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/tugboat/issues/11 If so, please reopen and add more info if possible. If you have access, please see DBlog to see if site/URL was actually created.

Redirect is not working after creating sandbox · Issue #11 · backdrop-contrib/tugboat
After creating a sandbox, the AJAX handler is not redirecting properly. ajax_command_redirect() requires a full URL, like /demo/foo, but it's being passed a relative one like demo/foo. This res...

Unfortunately, nothing gets logged in the dblog when this happens @BWPanda (Peter) ...there are only 2 tugboat-related messages, and both are older/unrelated:

  • Tugboat error #: Location: https://backdropcms.org/system/ajax / referrer https://backdropcms.org/demo
  • Deleted 73 previews older than May 28th, 2020.

@BWPanda (Peter) I've been thinking that we need to rework the Tugboat demos for each update. Rather than making all demos off master we should start making tags for each version, then making a new base preview at each release. That way we can leave existing sandboxes on the previous version (until they auto-destruct 24 hours later) and new sandboxes use the new version.
Right now when a new version comes out I usually rebuild all demos, which probably not only destroys their data but also causes our Tugboat usage to balloon temporarily and exceed the 40GB quota.
@Nate Lampton I can look into that later. Can you please create an issue (and tag me) to remind me?

Super, thanks, here we are: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdrop-tugboat/issues/12

Start Using Tags for Releases · Issue #12 · backdrop-ops/backdrop-tugboat
Each new release of Backdrop core, I push a change into the master branch. That currently includes merging in core, but after #10, that would be mostly automatic. However, after the release, it&#39...

Not sure if expected for the time being: I can create a demo, but when I open the link, I get a Tugboat "Failed" screen. Example: https://1-16-1-zpu71frwscngpkazsftmeknvcqp1slpj.tugboat.qa (created 5 min ago).
Yup, same happens for me too :disappointed:
@BWPanda (Peter) @Bug Squad looks like demo sites are broken on backdropcms.org The page shows "This preview is failed."https://1-16-1-tpaw06e6o0skuz58dphimsu5mxil4x2l.tugboat.qa/
@Nate Lampton sorry I keep forgetting that Zulip is terrible and that your name isn't "quicksketch" :( I meant to ping you about tugboat: https://1-16-1-tpaw06e6o0skuz58dphimsu5mxil4x2l.tugboat.qa/
Getting the "An error occurred: Project is Over Quota" error again.
@jenlampton @quicksketch ^^

Thanks @klonos, cleaning them up now. I filed an issue at https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/tugboat/issues/13 that should fix that problem in the Tugboat module, I may merge it and make a new release.

Use new "expires" option to clean up Tugboat previews · Issue #13 · backdrop-contrib/tugboat
A brand new (as of yesterday) feature was added to Tugboat to automatically clean up previews a particular time. When a preview is created, you may now specify an expires property. Tugboat itself w...
I hope that there is no way for anyone to know that most of those Tugboat demo sites were launched by me.
Don't be so sure about that @StPaulTim ...I might have something to do with it too :sweat_smile:

@quicksketch this has happened quite a few times now, and we seem to be randomly discovering it. Do you think it might be worth sending the "Project is Over Quota" errors to this Zulip channel here? (similarly to what we do for new forum posts in #Forum )
Hm, maybe? I haven't seen how difficult that is. We don't have any of the Zulip code on BackdropCMS.org, is that a module installed on the Forum site that does the notifications?

Yup, custom module: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/forum.backdropcms.org/tree/main/www/modules/custom/borg_zulip

backdrop-ops/forum.backdropcms.org
the forum for Backdropcms.org. Contribute to backdrop-ops/forum.backdropcms.org development by creating an account on GitHub.

What is the quota for Tugboat, and will they bump us up as an open source project?

An error occurred: Project is Over Quota
If I understand correctly, the problem might be that old sandboxes are not being deleted and that @quicksketch was going to look into that.

See back about 10 message in this topic: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/tugboat/issues/13

Use new "expires" option to clean up Tugboat previews · Issue #13 · backdrop-contrib/tugboat
A brand new (as of yesterday) feature was added to Tugboat to automatically clean up previews a particular time. When a preview is created, you may now specify an expires property. Tugboat itself w...
In the meantime, I think I should quit making such liberal use of Tugboat demo sites.
:grinning: I usually spin one up before I report an issue so I can test on a blank install first.
I do the same ...I sometimes may spin 3 or more sites/day :sweat_smile: ...sorry :sweat:
Thanks folks, I cleared out old sandboxes again. We keep accumulating 200+ sandboxes that don't get cleaned up. I'll apply that and make a new version of Tugboat module to get that fixed.
Demo quota reached again @quicksketch :sweat:
image.png
:frown: I've cleared them out again. Sorry I need to get on applying that Tugboat fix.
@quicksketch FYI, I've checked in 1password, and I can't see any entry for tugboat.
@klonos I think you setup your own Tugboat login, then someone can add you to Backdrop's Tugboat project (so it appears in your project list).

Thanks @BWPanda ...I already got a tugboat account (SSO via GitHub, in case that matters) ...now, is the next step to be added to https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdrop-tugboat ? ...and who do I get to add me?

backdrop-ops/backdrop-tugboat
A repository for spinning up Backdrop demo sites. Mirrors current Backdrop core repository. - backdrop-ops/backdrop-tugboat
Thanks for the invite @BWPanda ...I'm in :+1: ...now to figure out how to clean the stale demos, for the next time we run out of space :thinking:
I cut a new release of the Tugboat module and deployed to BackdropCMS.org. That _should_ fix the stale sandboxes issue.

@quicksketch it might be a good idea to check whether old sandboxes are being destroyed after this change ...don't wanna have issues with spinning up demo sites during the Backdrop Live event (I expect lots of folks to be doing that).
They're looking good @klonos! They have been auto-cleaning up as expected now :)
Wow! We have Tugboat for our testboxes now? :tada:
Ooops: Tugboat — Tugboat project is over quota (with a test run)

Yeah, @quicksketch was in touch with the Tugboat people and it seems that they will provide us with a separate 40GB account for our PRs (next tier requires dedicated hardware, and costs $$$/month) ...we may need to be a bit more cautious with the number of PRs we have open at each time (@quicksketch suggested that we destroy inactive PR sandboxes after 90 days or something like that).
At the moment, Tugboat sandboxes fail for our main site demos :disappointed:
@quicksketch or @jenlampton any chance that we can get the Tugboat account credentials in our Backdrop 1Password?

There are no shared credentials for tugboat. any individual will need their
own account, and they need to be added to our set-up.
Correct, since Tugboat accounts are tied to your GitHub profiles we don't have a shared password for Tugboat.
@indigoxela The folks at Tugboat will upgrade the account quota soon.

klonos said:

At the moment, Tugboat sandboxes fail for our main site demos :disappointed:

Looks like a permissions issue... Anyone know if SSH keys changed recently or anything like that?
image.png
Since they're likely using Let's Encrypt now, they'll change every 90ish days.
@quicksketch we seem to be well below our quota: image.png
...but the demo sandboxes are still failing :shrug:

Thanks on your work in https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4351 @BWPanda ++

Description of the need We are considering using Tugboat.qa for PR sandboxes for Backdrop core (since that's Tugboat's advertised feature). Proposed solution Backdrop core will have a new, ...
bwpanda :grinning: :heart: (Karma: 15)
Welcome!

Trying to fix Tugboat errors...
@BWPanda - Thanks for all the work you are doing! It is appreciated. I'm a bit overwhelmed right now with other things, but hope to help out more in near future.
Most fixed for now I think.
Oops, this topic is about the demos... I just fixed the PR sandboxes, not the demo sites...

@BWPanda sandboxes working great. I like how they're not spun up all the time. More efficient than zenci. Should save some server resources for Gor. And it seems like the automated tests only have cli and only for a brief time
Yeah tests are the next thing to fix. Either getting in touch with Gor about them, or migrating them elsewhere (Tugboat doesn't handle them I think).

Ok, made some major changes to Tugboat demo sites (i.e. a whole new repo: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos) and now they seem to work again.

backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos
Backdrop CMS demo sites powered by Tugboat. Contribute to backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos development by creating an account on GitHub.
@BWPanda ++

@BWPanda ++

Thanks so so much man :pray:

Location: http:///../.tugboat/auto-login.sh?../.tugboat/auto-login.sh
Message: Notice: Undefined index: REQUEST_METHOD in SchemaCache->__construct() (line 3895 of /var/lib/tugboat/backdrop/core/includes/bootstrap.inc).
Hmm, I'll look into it...
@Olaf Grabienski I found and fixed the problem, however I don't think it's important enough for a new release of the Tugboat code, so it'll be included when the next version of Backdrop is released.
Just made a small change to the Tugboat contrib module that should mean slightly faster build times for demo sites. Pushed the change up to B.org.
Maybe a silly question: how can I get a Tugboat instance for an existing PR? Turn it off and on again? Or is there more to do?
[so tempted to post an IT Crowd gif right now :laughing: ]
@indigoxela Yep, just turn off and on, or give me the PR number and I can do it from Tugboat dashboard.

Yep, just turn off and on

@BWPanda seems like it didn't work for me. https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/3265 Could it be a permission thing?

Issue #4509: Add webp if php version supports it by indigoxela · Pull Request #3265 · backdrop/backdrop
Fixes backdrop/backdrop-issues#4509 Note: you can not test this in the sandbox, as both php versions are too old.
I think might be issue with age of last commit. Please try merging latest 1.x into your branch and push again.
Off to bed now, will check tomorrow if that no work.

I think might be issue with age of last commit.

All tests are passing, though. It's only the Tugboat instance that didn't get created. Anyway, sleep well :zzz:

Yeah, nothing to do with tests. I think its something to do with the PR being made before Tugboat files were part of core. So if you merge inntye latest version of core then you'll get the Tugboat files. And pushing that to your branch will trigger a rebuild of the sandbox which will hopefully work.
@klonos had a similar problem with one if his PRs i think...
@indigoxela yup, as @BWPanda said, I merged latest 1.x into my branch, then pushed, and everything worked :+1:

One difference that I've noticed between the Tugboat PR sandboxes vs the ZenCI ones is that if I push a new commit, Tugboat rebuilds the instance (drops the db and starts afresh), whereas with Zen sandboxes it would retain any test data/settings. ...not sure which is best, but I was sort of used to this workflow:
-> create PR -> have people test and provide feedback -> push changes -> people would re-test using the same data/settings as before (although clearing caches was required sometimes)
...with the Tugboat demos, this becomes:
-> create PR -> have people test -> push changes -> people need to start testing from scratch

...not sure which is best; both have their merits. What I would like to avoid is people being demotivated to test is they need to start from scratch (especially in cases where there's a lot of manual data entry and settings tweaking in order to try to reproduce bugs etc.) :shrug:
I believe this was discussed and we decided to see how the sandboxes go for a while and gauge the community's response before deciding. And then open a new issue for it if a change is desired.
I think most people (who spoke up) said it was better have a fresh db with each commit

...wondering if it'd be valuable to configure the Tugboat PR sandboxes to show all error messages (admin/config/development/logging) by overriding the config via https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/blob/1.x/.tugboat/settings.local.php ...that would allow people testing to catch any errors early, and report them in the issue queue before changes are committed.

backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop core code repository. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop development by creating an account on GitHub.

I have considered that, even for my own local sandbox. But I came to the conclusion that it's better to test with as-vanilla-an-installation as possible. But I'm ok if others disagree and we decide to change Tugboat as such.

...yeah, the only hesitation I've had before proposing this is that it would mess PRs that assume/require errors to be hidden ...but then thought, how often does that happen compared to the total of PRs that we have? ...and how many errors/notices would we have caught if errors were enabled. Anyway, I'll let others chime in.
Sure. Open an issue, maybe even with a PR, and we can get feedback.

Done: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4741

Consider enabling all error messages for our PR sandboxes · Issue #4741 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
I also brought this up in our chat: ...wondering if it'd be valuable to configure the Tugboat PR sandboxes to show all error messages (admin/config/development/logging) by overriding the config...
@BWPanda is there an issue to remove the *.qa.backdropcms.org test boxes on new PRs now that we've got Tugboat working? I still noticed it on a new PR. Screenshot-from-2020-11-11-15-52-23.png
I believe Tugboat is still in 'trial mode', and until we officially decide to make the switch then Zen.ci sandboxes will continue to be used alongside.
Maybe worth opening an issue to deprecate Zen.ci sandboxes, then discussion can go there.
I believe we still wanted to talk with Gor first before doing anything...

I've been trying to spin up a demo sandbox, but nothing happens ...I get no errors/failures whatsoever ...just the spinning throbber with the "Please wait..." text ...if I refresh the page, I get a "New site created successfully!" message, but no link to the site or anything. Can someone else please give it a go and let me know if this issue is only on my end?

@BWPanda this one for when you get the chance: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos/issues/1

Cannot install contributed modules that do not have an official release. · Issue #1 · backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos
Since backdrop/backdrop-issues#4914 was raised, and https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/ckeditor_addon was mentioned as an alternative, I thought I'd give it a go in a demo sandbox, instead of ...
Thanks @klonos. Sounds like a duplicate of a core issue though... Can you confirm?
:thinking: ...not sure ...I think that it must be related to tugboat folder permissions and/or the modules download folder being outside docroot.
If you have a local setup where you can replicate that core issue, can you try using that to download the no-official-release module and see what happens?
@klonos I tested and confirmed that problem, but on my local with the same setup that produces that core bug. So closed that issue as a duplicate.
